content:
Coffee professionals differentiate between different coffee varietals and origins when assessing quality and complexity by evaluating various factors such as the taste, aroma, acidity, body, sweetness, and aftertaste. They use their sensory skills to identify the characteristics of different coffee varietals and origins. 

Origins can affect the flavor profile of coffee significantly, and professionals tend to focus on certain characteristics depending on the region. For example, coffees from Ethiopia are known for their fruity and floral notes, while coffees from Colombia are known for their sweet and nutty notes. 

In terms of varietals, professionals assess the quality and complexity of coffee by evaluating the flavor profile of each varietal. Some varietals, such as Bourbon and Geisha, are known for their unique flavor profiles that differentiate them from other varietals. 

Overall, coffee professionals use their sensory skills, knowledge of coffee origins, and varietals to assess the quality and complexity of different coffees.
